text: {| border=1 cellpadding=4 cellspacing=0 class="toccolours" style="float: right; width: 270px; clear: both; margin: 0.5em 0 1em 1em; border-style: solid; border:1px solid #7f7f7f; border-right-width: 2px; border-bottom-width: 2px; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%;" |+Zabrđe Забрђе |- | style="background: #ffffff; text-align:center;" colspan=2 | {| border=0 cellpadding=2 cellspacing=0 | style="text-align: center;" colspan="2" | 200px |- |} |- style="border-top: 2px solid gray;" | style="background: #f9f9f9; text-align:center;" colspan=2 | |- | style="vertical-align:top" | Location | Ugljevik, Republika Srpska |- |- | style="vertical-align:top" | Population - (est.) - (1991 census) | |- | Area code | +387 55 |- | Time zone | CET (UTC +1) CEST (UTC +2) |- | Website | |- |} Zabrđe (Serbian Cyrillic: Забрђе) is a village located in the Ugljevik municipality in Republika Srpska, Bosnia and Herzegovina. ==Population== ===Ethnic composition, 1991 census=== At the 1991 census, the total population was 1,725. There were 1,706 Serbs (98.89%), 7 "Yugoslavs" (0.40%), 2 Croats (0.11%), and 10 (0.57%) who were either of other or unknown origin. ==References== * Official results from the book: Ethnic composition of Bosnia-Herzegovina population, by municipalities and settlements, 1991. census, Zavod za statistiku Bosne i Hercegovine - Bilten no.234, Sarajevo 1991. Category:Ugljevik Category:Villages in Republika Srpska
title: Zabrđe (Ugljevik)
